Teams net points while player is on the court.

article.description:
Stephon Marbury had 41 points and 11 assists, and
committed no turnovers in 46 spectacular minutes as the Phoenix
Suns rallied to give the Dallas Mavericks their second loss in a
row, 107-102 Friday night.
article.headline: Streaking Suns win 11th straight at home
article.linkText: Marbury sinks 41 points, then buries the Mavs
article.story:
PHOENIX (AP) -- That Jason Kidd-for-Stephon Marbury trade isn't looking so one-sided these days.
Marbury

Marbury had 41 points and 11 assists, and committed no turnovers in 46 spectacular minutes as the Phoenix Suns rallied to give the Dallas Mavericks their second loss in a row, 111-106 Friday night. "That was awesome,'' Suns coach Frank Johnson said. "Certainly just an amazing performance. When it just looked as though we had no energy, no life, he put life into every last one of us.'' The Suns sank 10 of 19 3-pointers -- Marbury was 4-for-6 -- to win their 11th straight at home. It's their longest winning streak since March of 2000. Dallas, coming off a 123-94 loss at Sacramento on Wednesday night, has lost two in a row for the first time this season. "It's tough out here in the West,'' coach Don Nelson said. "We played two good home teams. I thought tonight we competed, but we didn't do enough to win.'' Steve Nash scored a season-high 32 points, including three 3-pointers in the first six minutes of the fourth quarter for the Mavericks. Dirk Nowitzki added 20 points and 14 rebounds. The Suns' 111 points was their season high. "If we want to win a championship, we've got to get better defensively,'' Nash said. "We can't worry about having the best record and all that stuff. We've got to play better defense.'' Marbury, who has averaged more than 30 points in his last six games, was 15-for-28 from the field in his seventh career 40-point game. He had 43 against San Antonio last Nov. 29. Joe Johnson scored a season-highs of 20 points and nine rebounds. Shawn Marion scored 16 and Casey Jacobsen 12 for the Suns. Phoenix sealed the victory by making 10 of 12 free throws over the last two minutes. The Mavericks shot 23 percent (6-for-26) and were outscored 33-21 in the fourth quarter. "The first three quarters is nothing. The end of the game is where it's at,'' Marbury said. "Not everybody can play in the fourth quarter.'' The Mavericks, who with the NBA's best record lost for just the seventh time this season, led 102-99 after Nowitzki's two free throws with 2:49 to play. Johnson's 12-foot bank shot cut it to 102-101 with 2:22 to go. "That's the best I've seen Joe Johnson play since he became a Sun,'' Marbury said. Jacobsen -- 6-for-6 from the foul line in the fourth quarter -- made two free throws to put Phoenix up for good at 103-102 with 1:58 to go. Jacobsen was fouled after Bo Outlaw grabbed an offensive rebound. Nelson complained that Outlaw clearly shoved a Dallas player out of the way but no foul was called. "That was a big non-call in the game,'' Nelson said. Outlaw sank one of two free throws to boost it to 104-102 with 1:05 remaining. Then, as Adrian Griffin drove down the lane, Marion knocked the ball away for a turnover. Marbury made his first free throw, then missed his second and Phoenix led 105-102 with 14.6 seconds remaining, but Marion grabbed the rebound on the miss and was fouled on the shot. He sank two free throws with 13.1 seconds to go to put Phoenix up 107-102. After trailing by as many as 11 in the third quarter, the Suns scored the first seven points in the fourth to tie it at 85 on Jacobsen's two free throws. Nash's third 3-pointer in less than six minutes boosted Dallas' lead to 96-92 with 6:18 to play. Jacobsen's 3-pointer, the Suns' 10th of the game and eighth of the second half, cut the Mavs' lead to 98-97 with 4:23 to play, and Marbury's two free throws gave Phoenix its first lead since the opening quarter, 99-98 with 3:32 to go. Game notes
Phoenix plays its next five on the road. ... The Suns are 18-3 at home, and their losses were by one, two and three points. ... Dallas was 25-for-27 at the foul line and Phoenix 25-for-29. ... Suns rookie Amare Stoudemire was on the bench down the stretch. ... Phoenix is 25-16 at the halfway mark of the season. ... Dallas is 5-4 on the road against Western Conference foes.

statistics.name: points
statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.name: fieldGoals
statistics.description: Field Goal makes and attempts.

statistics.name: freeThrows
statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.name: rebounds
statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.name: defensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.

statistics.description: The number of times when the offense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot.
